definitions: Native American people originally inhabiting regions of the Great Basin and northern Rocky Mountains
Uto-Aztecan language spoken by the Shoshone people in parts of the western United States
examples: The Shoshone traditionally lived as hunter-gatherers in the Great Basin
Sacagawea was a Shoshone woman who helped guide Lewis and Clark
Many elders still speak Shoshone fluently in their communities
The university offers courses in Shoshone language and culture

definitions: Jewish moneylender character from Shakespeare's The Merchant of Venice known for demanding his pound of flesh
informal offensive term for a ruthless moneylender or loan shark who charges excessive interest
examples: Shylock remains one of Shakespeare's most controversial characters in modern productions
The actor's portrayal of Shylock emphasized the character's humanity
The neighborhood loan shark was called a shylock by desperate borrowers
Such predatory lending practices earned him the nickname shylock

definitions: former name of Thailand used until 1939 and briefly again from 1945 to 1949
examples: The Kingdom of Siam maintained independence while neighboring countries were colonized
Anna Leonowens taught at the royal court of Siam in the 1860s

definitions: domestic cat breed originating from Thailand characterized by pointed coloration and blue eyes
relating to Siam (Thailand) or its people, language, or culture
describing twins or other organisms joined together at birth sharing body parts
examples: Our Siamese cat has striking blue eyes and a loud voice
The Siamese breed is known for being social and talkative
The museum displayed ancient Siamese artifacts from the Ayutthaya period
She studied Siamese court traditions for her doctoral thesis
The doctors successfully separated the Siamese twins after careful planning
These Siamese fighting fish must be kept in separate tanks

definitions: vast region of Russia extending from the Ural Mountains to the Pacific Ocean known for extreme cold
examples: The Trans-Siberian Railway crosses the entire width of Siberia
Political prisoners were exiled to remote camps in Siberia

definitions: relating to Siberia or its indigenous peoples, climate, or natural features
breed of domestic cat or dog originating from or associated with Siberia
examples: The Siberian winter temperatures can drop below minus sixty degrees
Siberian natural resources include vast forests and mineral deposits
Their Siberian husky loves pulling sleds in the snow
The Siberian tiger is the largest living cat species

definitions: person from Sicily or relating to the Italian island and its culture
Romance language variety spoken in Sicily distinct from standard Italian
popular chess opening beginning with the moves e4 c5
examples: The Sicilian restaurant serves traditional dishes from the island
My grandfather was Sicilian and immigrated to America in 1920
She learned to speak Sicilian from her grandmother before learning Italian
Many Sicilian words have Arabic and Greek influences
The Sicilian Defense is one of the most analyzed chess openings
He always responds to e4 with the Sicilian Defense

definitions: largest island in the Mediterranean Sea forming an autonomous region of southern Italy
examples: Sicily has been influenced by Greek, Roman, Arab, and Norman cultures
Mount Etna in Sicily is one of Europe's most active volcanoes

definitions: German multinational conglomerate corporation specializing in industrial manufacturing, energy, and healthcare technology
SI unit of electrical conductance equal to one ampere per volt
examples: Siemens manufactures everything from medical imaging equipment to high-speed trains
She works as an engineer at Siemens developing wind turbines
The conductance was measured at three siemens in the laboratory
One siemens equals the reciprocal of one ohm of resistance

definitions: Italian title equivalent to Mrs. or madam used for married women or as a polite form
examples: The waiter addressed her as Signora throughout the evening
Signora Rossi will be teaching the Italian literature course

definitions: follower of Sikhism, a monotheistic religion founded in Punjab in the 15th century
relating to Sikhism or its practitioners, culture, and traditions
examples: The Sikh community celebrates Vaisakhi as their new year festival
Many Sikhs wear turbans as an article of their faith
The Sikh temple welcomes visitors of all faiths for free meals
She studied Sikh philosophy and its emphasis on equality

definitions: monotheistic religion founded by Guru Nanak in the 15th century emphasizing equality, service, and devotion to one God
examples: Sikhism teaches the importance of honest living and sharing with others
The Golden Temple in Amritsar is the holiest site in Sikhism

definitions: act considered to be a violation of divine law or moral principles
abbreviation for sine, a trigonometric function in mathematics
examples: Many religions teach that confession can absolve one of sin
Pride is considered one of the seven deadly sins
Calculate the value of sin 30 degrees for this problem
The sin function produces a wave pattern when graphed

definitions: triangular peninsula in Egypt between the Mediterranean Sea and Red Sea
biblical mountain where Moses received the Ten Commandments according to religious tradition
examples: The Sinai Peninsula connects Africa to Asia at the Suez Canal
Bedouin tribes have inhabited the Sinai desert for centuries
Mount Sinai remains an important pilgrimage site for multiple religions
According to scripture, Moses spent forty days on Mount Sinai

definitions: legendary sailor from Middle Eastern folklore featured in One Thousand and One Nights tales
examples: Sinbad the Sailor encountered mythical creatures on his seven voyages
The adventures of Sinbad have been adapted into numerous films

definitions: island city-state in Southeast Asia known as a global financial center and multicultural society
examples: Singapore transformed from a trading post to a modern metropolis
The Port of Singapore is one of the busiest in the world

definitions: citizen of Singapore or relating to Singapore and its multicultural society
examples: Singaporean cuisine blends Chinese, Malay, and Indian influences
Many Singaporeans speak multiple languages including English and Mandarin

definitions: person who performs songs or other vocal music professionally or as a hobby
brand name of sewing machines manufactured by the Singer Corporation since 1851
examples: The opera singer received a standing ovation for her performance
She works as a backup singer for various recording artists
My grandmother's antique Singer sewing machine still works perfectly
Singer dominated the home sewing machine market for decades

definitions: Native American peoples including Dakota, Lakota, and Nakota nations of the Great Plains
group of related languages spoken by the Sioux peoples
examples: The Sioux fought to protect their lands during westward expansion
Many Sioux tribes maintain their cultural traditions on reservations
She studies Sioux languages and their grammatical structures
Lakota is one of the major Sioux language varieties

definitions: polite or formal way to address a man, especially in service contexts
title given to knights and baronets in the British honours system
examples: Excuse me, sir, you dropped your wallet
The waiter asked, 'What would you like to order, sir?'
Sir Paul McCartney was knighted by Queen Elizabeth II
Sir Isaac Newton made groundbreaking scientific discoveries

definitions: loud warning device that produces a wailing sound for emergency vehicles or alerts
mythological creature, half-woman half-bird or mermaid, whose singing lured sailors to destruction
alluring or dangerously seductive woman who attracts and potentially ruins men
examples: The ambulance siren wailed as it rushed through traffic
The tornado siren alerted residents to seek shelter immediately
Odysseus had his crew plug their ears to resist the sirens' song
Greek sailors feared the sirens who dwelt on rocky islands
The film noir featured a dangerous siren who manipulated the detective
She played the role of a siren in the Broadway musical

definitions: female person who shares one or both parents with another person
woman belonging to a religious order, especially a Catholic nun
thing or organization that is similar to or associated with another
examples: My sister and I shared a bedroom growing up
She has three sisters and two brothers
Sister Mary teaches at the Catholic elementary school
The sisters at the convent dedicate their lives to service
Our sister company operates in the European market
San Francisco and Shanghai are sister cities

definitions: person who watches and cares for children or pets temporarily
person who poses for an artist or photographer
something very easy to accomplish or an unmissable opportunity in sports
examples: We need a sitter for Saturday night while we attend the wedding
The dog sitter comes twice daily when we travel
The artist asked the sitter to remain still for two hours
Several famous sitters posed for Rembrandt's portraits
He missed an absolute sitter in front of the goal
That exam question was a sitter for anyone who studied

definitions: one of the principal deities in Hinduism, known as the destroyer and transformer within the Trimurti
examples: Devotees worship Siva at temples throughout India and Nepal
The cosmic dance of Siva represents the cycle of creation and destruction

definitions: first United States space station launched by NASA that operated from 1973 to 1979
examples: Skylab proved humans could live and work in space for extended periods
Three separate crews occupied Skylab during its operational lifetime

definitions: member of the largest European ethnolinguistic group including Russians, Poles, Czechs, and others
examples: Many Slavs migrated to North America in the late nineteenth century
The museum exhibits artifacts from various Slav cultures

definitions: relating to the Slavs or their languages including Russian, Polish, Czech, and others
examples: Slavic languages share many grammatical features and vocabulary
The festival celebrates Slavic music and dance traditions

definitions: relating to the Slavs or their languages, especially in religious or historical contexts
examples: Old Church Slavonic was the first literary Slavic language
The manuscript was written in Slavonic script

definitions: person from Slovakia or relating to Slovakia and its culture
West Slavic language spoken primarily in Slovakia
examples: Slovak immigrants established communities throughout North America
Traditional Slovak folk costumes are worn during festivals
She learned Slovak to communicate with her grandparents
Slovak and Czech languages are mutually intelligible

definitions: landlocked country in Central Europe that became independent in 1993 after separating from Czechoslovakia
examples: Slovakia joined the European Union in 2004
The Tatra Mountains form Slovakia's northern border with Poland

definitions: person from Slovenia or relating to Slovenia and its culture
South Slavic language spoken primarily in Slovenia
examples: Slovene athletes competed successfully in the Winter Olympics
The Slovene community preserves its cultural heritage abroad
Slovene has dual grammatical number, unusual among modern languages
She translates poetry from Slovene into English

definitions: country in Central Europe known for its mountains, forests, and Adriatic coastline
examples: Slovenia was the first former Yugoslav republic to join the European Union
Lake Bled in Slovenia attracts tourists from around the world

definitions: relating to Slovenia, its people, culture, or the Slovene language
examples: Slovenian wine has gained international recognition in recent years
The Slovenian Alps offer excellent skiing and hiking opportunities

definitions: person who works with metal, especially by forging iron or steel
one of the most common surnames in English-speaking countries
examples: The village smith forged horseshoes and farm tools
A skilled smith can create intricate decorative ironwork
John Smith is often used as a generic name in examples
The Smith family has lived in this town for generations

definitions: elongated limbless reptile of the suborder Serpentes found on every continent except Antarctica
person who betrays trust or acts in a deceitful, treacherous manner
flexible tool used to clear blockages from pipes and drains
examples: The snake slithered silently through the grass hunting for prey
Some snakes are venomous while others kill by constriction
Don't trust him, he's a snake who will betray you
That snake pretended to be my friend while spreading rumors
The plumber used a snake to clear the clogged drain
We need a longer snake to reach the blockage

definitions: beloved beagle character from Charles Schulz's Peanuts comic strip known for imagination and adventures
person who is excessively curious or pries into others' affairs
examples: Snoopy imagines himself as the World War I Flying Ace
Children love reading about Snoopy and Charlie Brown
The snoopy neighbor always watches everyone from her window
Don't be so snoopy about my personal business

definitions: atmospheric water vapor frozen into ice crystals that fall as white flakes
white powdery or granular substance resembling frozen precipitation
random dot pattern on a television or display screen caused by weak signal
examples: Heavy snow forced the school to close for two days
The first snow of winter covered the landscape in white
The cocaine was referred to as snow in the undercover operation
Artificial snow covered the movie set for the winter scene
The old television showed nothing but snow after midnight
Adjust the antenna to reduce the snow on the screen

definitions: fashionable district in Manhattan, New York or London known for shopping, art galleries, and nightlife
examples: Artists transformed Soho from industrial warehouses into trendy lofts
We had dinner at a new restaurant in Soho last night

definitions: ancient city destroyed by God according to biblical accounts for its wickedness
place characterized by vice, corruption, or depravity
examples: The destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah appears in Genesis
Archaeological expeditions have searched for the ruins of Sodom
Critics called the nightclub district a modern Sodom
The corrupt city had become a Sodom of greed and excess

definitions: Roman god of the sun, equivalent to Greek Helios
fifth note of the musical scale in solmization
former or current monetary unit in various Latin American countries
examples: Sol Invictus was an important deity in late Roman religion
The temple of Sol stood prominently in ancient Rome
In the song, the melody rises from do to sol
The choir practiced the sol-fa syllables repeatedly
Peru's currency is the sol, replacing the inti in 1991
The price was listed as fifty soles

definitions: third king of Israel known for wisdom, wealth, and building the First Temple in Jerusalem
person of exceptional wisdom or good judgment in difficult situations
examples: King Solomon's judgment about the disputed baby demonstrated his wisdom
The Song of Solomon is attributed to the biblical king
We need a Solomon to resolve this complex dispute fairly
She showed the wisdom of Solomon in mediating the conflict

definitions: person from Somalia or of Somali ethnic descent from the Horn of Africa
Cushitic language spoken by the Somali people in Somalia and neighboring regions
examples: The Somali community has established businesses throughout the city
Traditional Somali poetry plays an important cultural role
She teaches Somali to children at the community center
Somali uses the Latin alphabet for its written form

definitions: country in the Horn of Africa bordered by Ethiopia, Kenya, and the Indian Ocean
examples: Somalia has the longest coastline on Africa's mainland
International efforts continue to stabilize Somalia after years of conflict

definitions: wide-brimmed hat traditionally worn in Mexico and southwestern United States for sun protection
examples: The mariachi musicians wore decorated sombreros during their performance
His sombrero shaded him from the intense desert sun

definitions: male child in relation to either or both of his parents
male descendant or person considered as if in a filial relationship
informal way to address a younger male, often patronizingly
examples: Their son graduated from medical school last year
The father taught his son how to ride a bicycle
He was a true son of Ireland, proud of his heritage
The sons of the revolution continued their ancestors' work
Listen here, son, let me give you some advice
The coach called out, 'Good job, son!'

definitions: musical composition with lyrics intended to be sung by the human voice
melodious sounds produced by birds for communication or territorial marking
lyrical poem or something resembling song in character or effect
examples: Her new song topped the charts for six weeks
The choir performed traditional folk songs at the concert
The robin's morning song woke us at dawn
Each bird species has its distinctive song pattern
The Song of Solomon is a biblical book of poetic verse
Her speech had the rhythm and flow of song

definitions: teacher of philosophy and rhetoric in ancient Greece who charged fees for instruction
person who uses clever but fallacious arguments to deceive or confuse others
examples: The sophists taught wealthy Athenians the art of public speaking
Plato criticized the sophists for prioritizing persuasion over truth
Don't be fooled by that sophist's misleading arguments
The debate descended into sophistry rather than honest discussion

definitions: historic university in Paris, originally founded as a theological college in 1257, now part of several Paris universities
examples: She studied philosophy at the Sorbonne in the 1960s
The Sorbonne remains a symbol of French academic excellence

definitions: cereal grain plant cultivated for food, animal feed, and syrup production, especially in warm climates
examples: Sorghum grows well in drought conditions where other grains fail
The farmer planted sorghum as a rotation crop after wheat
